intro: Palicourea quizhpei, commonly known as the purple-flowered palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers, which are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are usually opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Palicourea quizhpei is often found in humid, shaded environments such as cloud forests.
